>
[Torag's Silver Anvil](/Equipment.aspx?ID=575)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 123 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Price** 24,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

**Bulk** 2
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Meteor Hammer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=97)
</row>

**Access** follower of  Torag 

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This portable silver anvil has a narrow hoop on one end, through which a long, sturdy chain has been strung. _[Torag's](/Deities.aspx?ID=18) Silver Anvil_ can be wielded as a _+3 [holy](/Equipment.aspx?ID=299) [greater flaming](/Equipment.aspx?ID=295) [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [silver](/Equipment.aspx?ID=379) [meteor hammer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=97)_. Outside of combat, the anvil can be used with a hammer as an incredibly effective portable forge, heating up the metal to be forged without a furnace and granting a +3 item bonus to [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) checks involving metalworking. When you use the anvil to successfully [Repair](/Actions.aspx?ID=42) a metal item, the item recovers an additional 10 Hit Points (or an additional 20 on a critical success).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
